intro: Cnidium tachiroei, commonly known as Japanese hogweed, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its large, umbrella-shaped inflorescence. The plant has thick, hairy stems and broad, pinnately compound leaves. It is known for its toxic sap, which can cause skin irritation and photosensitivity. Despite its potential hazards, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
